alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 3:32PM CST until March 12 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Arcadia, Dodge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM CST Wednesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling to 8.9 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CST.
